reviews.name: Zuya
reviews.title: Better than Cotarie!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2024
reviews.product_specs: Size: Size 5 (96 Count)Color: Born to Run
reviews.review:
My little has excessive and very sensitive skin.
We've used buggies, pampers, honest, Kirkland, million moon and finally found a winner with cotarie BUT cotarie diapers pants have an adjustable waist with velcro that fastens in the front right where the baby's legs move forward when sitting. The velcro comes apart and rubs and are also too narrow in the middle causing a baby wedgie. Parasol solves both of those issues, is softer, more absorbant, and far better at stopping leaks. Zero rashes and even after an entire night of heavy peeing, the baby's bitt was dry to touch. Diaper was saturated but more effective at pulling the moisture away from the skin than any that we've tried.
Super easy to put on a wiggly toddler, and easy to wrap up and toss with the built in tape on the back. Also, they are so stretchy that my little one can wear 3/4 or 5/6 confortably.
Worth every penny. Definitely a "high end diaper" Which is why I compare it mostly to cotarie.
If you have a child with sensitive skin, the most important purchase it the item they will be wearing 24/7, so the diaper quality is critical. Highly recommend.

I certainly couldn’t afford to use these 24/7, but they make a great overnight and occasional disposable diaper when we aren’t using our cloth diapers.

reviews.name: Colorgirl
reviews.title: One Of The Softest Disposable Diapers Ever!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2019
reviews.review:
We have quite a few new babies in our life. When we saw these diapers, we had to try them out. We are glad we did.

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
First of all, they are ADORABLE. The designs are really cute and make for a fun appearance of the baby. The jeans is our favorite. Front and back design is brilliant. They come in a compact package for easy storage while using them.

SOFT?
These are the softest disposables we have felt yet, and the other moms who tried them loved them too.

CLOSURE
The closure is velcro and it is resealable. It is great for this size which is pretty much newborn to very small and the baby is not moving around a lot. I am not sure how well they would stay shut for larger more active babies.

ABSORBENCY?
These absorbed very well. They held all of the waste very well without having to be changed constantly due to leaking. Again, this size is very small, so the baby is not exuding large amounts of waste so it worked great.

LEAKING?
These diapers did not leak for this really small size. The elastic on the legs and top back is strong so it keeps the diaper from leaking. For larger sizes, I am not sure how this would be. For this size, it was fabulous.

WOULD THESE BE BOUGHT AGAIN?
These diapers are great to have. They are a bit more expensive than cheaper brands, but would be great for special use at least. The other moms I asked to try these were very impressed and wanted to buy them again.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Appealing to three sets of moms, these diapers are cream of the crop. Adorable in appearance, easy to use and wear, and with little leaking, they were a winner. In a larger size the closures might not work as well, but for small babies, it was fine.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. These are really nice diapers. It was a pleasure to test them out. Yeah, I probably would buy again in the future. They also make a GREAT gift for a new mom.

reviews.name: Inked Phoenix
reviews.title: A company with whimsy has made a GREAT diaper (pics and a wet test!)
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
reviews.review:
Full disclosure when I was offered these Clear + Dry disposable diapers in a size 3 I did not grab them for me but an immediate family member with 2 kids in diapers. I would consider these "premium" diapers as at $36 for a package of 64 is considerably more than the nearly same cost national brand I got them recently whose box contained 204. Both diapers tested well in my reviews for wetness- the national brand had an issue with the wetness indicator in my opinion- but know that there are options for everyone and every budget.

These diapers come beautifully packaged with kids in mind, they encourage you to use the box again, even as an art project with its printed squirrel inside. The company has a wonderful sense of whimsy and humor with this design with the fake jean pockets (and with the jeans it continues on the other side) and cute "see you at 2:00 AM" quote on the other. The diaper itself is super light and soft- I admit to having a hard time opening the diaper and keeping it open without having to hold it down, so you may have a hard time changing a particularly squirmy little one. I don't remember having that sort of issues with other diapers, but then again at 2:00 AM we all have issues there. Part of it may be these are considerably less bulky than some other diapers can be (not that they're all that bulky anymore, but these are rather thin). The wetness indicator, when dry is VERY clear and yellow right down the middle of the diaper. I was a bit concerned that my 1 cup water test I usually do with diapers would easily overhwhelm the leak guard walls- they are small and soft, but only the test will tell! The "velcro" closures are even less abrasive than the national brand I reviewed before but I believe neither would scratch or irritate a baby- these especially. Easy open/close and/or repositioning several times.

The wet test was the most impressive I've seen so far of the 3 total I've done for Amazon reviews. I poured as I usually do an entire cup of water into the diaper and watched as the diaper took a mere 11 seconds to absorb it all! Then about 80 seconds TOTAL later the surface of the diaper was dry to the touch. Great diaper!!! The wetness indicator is VERY clear, what was yellow is now blue- time for a change!

At first I thought I could overwhelm these very nicely presented diapers- but I'm convinced, for those with the budget, these are SUPER nice.

reviews.name: TheCatsMeow
reviews.title: Soft, Comfortable, and Absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
reviews.review:
The PARASOL Clear+Dry Disposable Diapers are the softest most gentle disposable diapers I've ever used on any of my three children.

I got these in the size 5 which is for 26+ Pounds and up. That said, I found these to fit well on my child in that weight range without being too wide, short, or looseness.

These diapers feature two designs. One of the diapers reads"See You at 2am" on the backside and the other diaper pattern mimics blue jeans.The colors are gender neutral being white and gray.

There is a yellow strip wetness indicator which I find to be incredibly helpful in knowing whether or not my child needs a change. These are very absorbent and I've never felt wetness on the outside or seen any get on my child's clothes.

These diapers are not scented at all which is preferred by my household that has scent sensitivities.

I am pleased that no rashes, itching, or other skin irritations have been caused by these.

The diapers work well and though they are bit highly priced, they are well worth it. Recommended!

reviews.name: Musicbookfan
reviews.title: Super soft! Gentle soft absorbent disposables. Great leak protection.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
reviews.review:
These Clear & Dry are absolutely fantastic disposable diapers. My grand babies, 6 months and toddler, are both in cloth diapers most all of the time - when a disposable is needed these are perfect, and will be just as perfect for babyies using disposables all the time.

They're so SOFT! Inside and the exterior as well. The gentle double leg gussets are comfortable against baby's legs yet fit snug enough to keep the diaper well fitting and prevent leaks. Top of the diapers, front and back, are super soft - very gentle against baby's tummy and back.

The "gripper" closure is soft as well! No hook and loop scratchy itchy noisy sticky tape design here - the "gripper" is soft to the touch, quiet when readjusted (no loud tear-away sound like many other diapers have), and yet really holds tight. How it manages to be so soft and quiet and yet hold the diaper in place is a clever design.

Leakproof - even for messy diapers. 5 stars for absorbency.

These run true to size per the chart, maybe even a bit generous. The size 4 L have plenty of room for my 18# grand baby but still fit leak proof, and they fit my 18 month old grand baby just as comfortably, although she could go up a size and have some more room in the diaper.

The package itself has a unique packaging material - it's not thin plastic like most disposables, but a heavier weight plastic - hard to describe - but substantial. Tear proof when lifting and carrying the bag. Easy tear opening at the top.

These are just great disposable diapers - highly recommend!

reviews.name: Jessie
reviews.title: Clean materials, soft, absorbent, unique, good value to comparable diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
reviews.review: I love the materials used in these diapers. They are safe and clean. The packaging is also really nice. I think for what you get it's a really good deal compared to similar diapers. The designs are really unique. To look at the diapers, they seem really thin and light with small flimsy little tabs but they are actually durable and the tabs stick really well. They inside is really soft. They are so thin I didn't think they'd absorb well. My child isn't in this size at the moment but I tested them by pouring water on it(more than they'd be urinating a few times) and came back a little later and it was completely dry. I was really surprised and happy with that. That back of the package was informative.

reviews.name: Allison Chang
reviews.title: Convenient, more sustainable, so thin!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2022
reviews.review: These are fantastic. We tried Honest before this and I thought they were fine but more papery feeling than Huggies or Pampers. Parasol is SO THIN and I just put it on a bit higher up so it doesn’t bunch on the bottom. We had blow outs but I think that’s just our baby, since that happened with every brand. I love that the tabs are HUGE and it’s basically impossible to not have the ruffles properly on the outside because of how big they are. Very easy to put on. We are probably staying with this brand

reviews.name: KAT
reviews.title: They are all they advertise to be!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
reviews.review: I didn't want to make the absorbency test on a real baby because if the diaper failed, didn't want a mess on my hands. I poured about a quarter cup of water into the diaper. The yellow line on the exterior of the diaper turned blue, nice indicator of wetness. It is an incredible diaper! Sucked the water right up, did not feel in the least bit damp, and the lining and outer shell is buttery soft. Wish these had been around 30 years ago when I fought with leaky, plasticky, diaper rash inducing disposables. Nice pull tabs that don't have a piece that covers the sticky part that I had to find a trash can for. The tabs just stick to the diaper, make no noise so no startling a young un. Great diaper!!!

reviews.name: MM1000
reviews.title: Trendy, effective, soft diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2020
reviews.review:
We had to wait a little while before we could use these, as these were sized a bit larger than expected, but once we used them we were quite pleased. They are softer than the two major brands, and seem more comfortable. That comes are a price, in that the diapers are 'lighter' and thinner, with less of a pulp inner layer to absorb.

The seal around the legs works well, provided you do pull it out a bit into place, and though the velcro closure isn't indestructable, we had no problem with it, and it was wide enough to be comfortable. We never experienced a leak with these, but my confidence level was a bit lower than a huge swaddler type diaper to leave on my daughter for really long periods of time.

Fortunately, we tend to not have to do that, and my daughter does seem to prefer these, move around more freely, and yes, looks a little cuter in the blue-jeans style pattern.

I can understand the difference upsetting someone who gets a diaper that weighs have as much and is seemingly flimsy, but we really had no leaks at all. And there is one huge bonus: our Diaper Genie fills with diapers more slowly if the diapers aren't enormous.

These are ideal if you expect to change your baby a lot, perhaps for appointments or day care. These aren't the ones for road trips or the like. We also don't use these overnight too often. If you manage your expectations, these are really comfortable and light. I like them a lot.

reviews.name: Miranda
reviews.title: perfect fit and so very soft! no rash or lines
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers fit my 1 year old great! They are the perfect fit and size for his 21-22lb frame. I think he likes wearing them. they feel incredibly soft! it was nice to see no leaks while prolonged wearing during the day. i only have to change him every 2-3 hours. I like that the material is made out of natural ingredient... i dont like using any chemical on my baby. so this is very nice to use for a natural minded mama and baby! they are cute to look at too! they have little fun sayings on them, "see you at 2 am!" ahah funny but not too funny when it happens to you!

reviews.name: Scentsualshopper
reviews.title: Five stars
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2020
reviews.review: These are excellent diapers. They are thick and absorbent but not too thick as to be uncomfortable. After the entire package, we didn’t have ONE leak!!! My son did not react to these diapers so they seem to be hypoallergenic as stated. On par with all the higher brand diapers. They are a touch expensive, but they are a great option if you have a sensitive skin baby like I do!

reviews.name: Jessica
reviews.title: Soft and dry
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.review:
These diapers are so cute! Even the box they come in is cute (it’s designed to allow your kids to play with it after it’s opened)

The diapers fit well. They’re soft and thin (I love thin diapers for diaper bag and storage purposes!) and they’ve had no issue holding in pee and poo. The only negative I have for this brand is the price as other diapers perform similarly (it feels like you’re really paying for the cute factor more than anything)

reviews.name: Shasta daisy
reviews.title: Cute/unique design on these Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019
reviews.review: The design of these diapers is so cute they look like little pants, or say see you at 2am, etc. they have no scent (perfumes) used yet also do not have a strong odor after baby has used them either which is great! I really like these diapers my nephew hasn’t had any rashes with them and we haven’t had any problems with leakage even in the nighttime. I would definitely recommend these diapers!

reviews.name: Jason
reviews.title: so soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are so so soft and comfortable. The material is clearly very breathable and comfortable. Even directly when changing a very wet diaper, my baby's skin was visibly dry. The material is soft and cushy and it feels almost like cloth. The tabs stick well and don't come off accidentally, with no problems ripping. We had no problems with leaks, even on really wet changes. I would definitely recommend these diapers!

reviews.name: L Robinson
reviews.title: Good green diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
reviews.review: I don’t understand the bad reviews for these diapers. We use the size 3 on our 16 pound baby. So, she’s on the low end of weight for the size (16-26 pounds). They rise higher on her belly, but they are fine around her thighs. We’ve had no leaks, even overnight. No rashes or skin issues. They are pretty soft, but I have used softer diapers. The print is cute & there are animals on the box that encourages kids to color & reuse the box. The baby that uses the diapers is too young for that, but my older children enjoyed coloring the box. I think this is a good, reasonably priced green diaper.

reviews.name: S. Beck
reviews.title: Nice!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2020
reviews.review: Nice diapers - the baby gets changed often so it's hard to say how many times / how long it could be left. But they seem nice, stay put and she's having no reaction.

reviews.name: Moises Garcia Landeros
reviews.title: Highly recommend these diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
reviews.review: I enjoyed my first experience of these diapers from the opening of the box onward. The box is very consumer friendly with a riddle and picture inside that children can paint/use as a craft. The feeling of the packaging is unique and high-quality. The diapers themselves are incredibly soft, with cute prints and sayings. The tabs on the diapers are durable easy to grasp when changing a squirmy infant. The diapers have a yellow urine line that changes color when the diaper is soiled. I have not yet seen any leaking or blowouts while using these diapers and they are very absorbent. In addition to all of these things, the diapers are made of earth-friendly ingredients that are safe for my daughter. I have not seen any reaction, irritation, or rashes from these diapers.

reviews.name: Barbells&Books
reviews.title: Super soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
reviews.review: These are so cute! Not to mention very accurate with the saying “see you at 2am” lol. They are probably the softest diapers I have ever felt. They also fit true to size. The absorbency is great, but I wouldn’t let them lay in it throughout the night because like any diaper once they are full, they’re full. I definitely recommend, they are supposed to prevent rash and any mom knows rashes are a hassle so anything to prevent is great.

reviews.name: A. Williams
reviews.title: High quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
reviews.review: You can tell these diapers are high quality before you even open the (almost rain jacket material) bag that these diapers are packaged in. They are telling the truth when they say these are as soft as cloth!! My daughter had no leaks overnight (10 hours) and no diaper rash in the morning. I highly recommend these!!

reviews.name: SBoldig
reviews.title: Surprise - these are fantastic!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020
reviews.review: Trying this diapers, I was a bit skeptical. I am a huggies mom, through and through. I had never heard of Parasol, but was open to trying these. They were great! No leaking, no skin reactions, nothing. They did exactly as they were supposed to, and they are just the cutest design as well! Would recommend! Wish these were at my local retailers.

reviews.name: @Exceptionally_K
reviews.title: Love these diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
reviews.review: I absolutely love these diapers. It feels like cloth diapers to me, without being cloth diapers. Super absorbent. Love the elastic waistband to keep blowouts in their place. Quality materials without the unnecessary chemicals and dyed. Wish I knew about this brand for my other babies.

reviews.name: Family7
reviews.title: Stay on well, and do not irritate my son's very sensitive skin.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.review:
I have tried numerous diapers in my past for three of my children. I have to attest to the fact that these particular diapers are probably the softest and most luxurious I have tried. I use them on my 15 month old baby. He is a real mover, and recently started walking. His skin is sensitive, and these diapers simply are amazing because they cause him no irritation and no redness whatsoever. They also hold in a lot of fluid, and are easily put on and stay on well.
No complaints from us, and no complaints from my kiddo.
Totally recommended. Worth a try. I hope I was helpful. Thank you.

reviews.name: Kristina Werner
reviews.title: Adorable, Absorbent & A More Natural Fit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
reviews.review:
I am Really Happy with these New Diapers!!
They are honestly the most absorbent and padded Diapers I have ever used for my little ones and we usually use the higher-end ones. I was really impressed their curved edges, providing a more comfortable and natural fit. They are scent-free and have been great for my Daughter’s sensitive skin. Their designs are also super adorable! I have yet to experience a blow out with these.
Would definitely recommend them!

reviews.name: Declan
reviews.title: Recommend
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2020
reviews.review: Great fit and overall very satisfied! No blowouts, sensitive skin friendly, and very soft. No complaints here! I really love that it’s also free from chlorine, alcohol, dyes, chemicals, fragrances, lotions, parabens, phthalates, preservatives, latex, and heavy metals. Five stars!

reviews.name: Matt
reviews.title: Fit well and hold a lot
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
reviews.review: These are actually really good diapers. I wasn't expecting them to be, but they fit well and keep the liquids in and solids in as well. The liquid stays in well and doesn't make the diaper too heavy or bulky. The solids stay in well too. Overall, great diapers!

reviews.name: Carfo
reviews.title: The softest diapers I've seen yet
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
reviews.review: The diapers are very soft. They fit well and are good at absorbing. The package they came in was tough too. Very quality diapers!

reviews.name: Miss Campbell
reviews.title: Very soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019
reviews.review:
These diapers are incredibly soft. They feel almost like a tea towel or dish rag instead of a diaper. They also seem to be slightly bigger than other brands of comparable sizes, which means they give more coverage up the body of the baby.
Can we talk about how cute these are?! The little sayings and pictures are hilarious! But come on, who wants a cute diaper if they leak all over? The good thing is, we've had good luck with these diapers working well, and being really absorbent. Cute, absorbent, don't smell bad when they're wet like some chemically heavy diapers, and fit well.

reviews.name: Kcorn
reviews.title: No more rashes and no more guilt. These are kind for babies and the planet.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2019
reviews.review:
There was a learning curve when learning to use these diapers. Totally worth it. Diaper Rash? Gone. Guilt about using diapers harmful to the planet? Gone. And these passed the leak test once I learned how to obtain a proper fit. It didn’t take long but, as noted, there was a brief learning curve. For one thing, these don’t have the super sticky tabs I was used to. I kept trying to find them. Then I learned that I just had to pull one tab over the other and adjust the tightness. The tabs stayed firmly affixed . I also took a diaper and poured water into it, just to test the absorbency and ability to keep wetness under the diaper surface. I was impressed by the results.

I was wary about how thin these diapers are, not super thick, but don’t be fooled by that. They expand and do as well as any other diaper.

reviews.title: Love them
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
reviews.review: These was been so great for my baby. She sleep all night and no leak. They hold very well. She moves everywhere and they do not fall off or come undone. Great design.

reviews.name: Techie
reviews.title: Very absorbent and soft all over
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are truly unscented, and very absorbent and soft all over. Even the Velcro closure at the sides are less hard than on other diapers. The inner lining is of a type I'd never seen before, it is soft and kind of cotton-like material. Basically, comfortable on my baby's skin. So far, no leakings or diaper rash. I plan on ordering again for sure.

reviews.name: Get Skittles
reviews.title: great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are adorable. I especially love the little pants design of some of these diapers. So cute. In addition to the aesthetics, these diapers are so incredibly soft and stretchy so they are super comfortable and you can get an excellent fit. They are a bit more puffy than other brands, but they also seem to be more absorbent than other brands, so I will totally take a little extra poof for a little better absorbency. There is nothing I do not like about these diapers except that you will need scissors to get into the package.

reviews.name: TangibleReads
reviews.title: diapering in style
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2019
reviews.review: These Clear and Dry diapers are setting a higher bar for diapers. Not only do the keep the baby dry with multiple layers, but they add style with the different designs. I like the green leafy ones best. Baby kept pointing to it. The quiet tabs are unique (don't know if i care much about that but it's an interesting feature. The elastic doesn't pinch and haven't had any messy leaks thus far. Good diaper and I give it a thumbs up to purchase.

reviews.name: mom2howmany
reviews.title: Super soft Super cute
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
reviews.review: Definitely the softest diapers I have ever used. The designs are also the cutest I’ve seen. The absorbency is comparable to other big brands. They are sturdy and don’t rip, even at the tabs. The leg elastic doesn’t bother my sensitive skinned baby. For a newborn this would be high on my list but once they start having blowouts I’m not sure there’s enough elastic in the back to contain (or at least help contain) that. Also, the brand we usually use has double velcro on the tabs for a more stable fit. These work ok now but once baby is moving more I’m not sure that will be the case.

reviews.name: J. Silva
reviews.title: Super soft, cute design
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2019
reviews.review: Since these are a gift for the little boy who’s expected in January, we can’t review the absorbency and fit of these diapers as yet. We can say that the designs on the bum are so cute —“See you at 2 am”, well yeah...They are super soft while also very sturdy. We like that they are supposedly better for the environment. Mommy to be was raised with cloth diapers, but she won’t have the resources to do that with her own baby, so these are a good alternative. We will update once the diapers are in use!

reviews.name: Wifey
reviews.title: All diapers should be like these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
reviews.review: Super cute diapers. I love how they have messages/drawings on them. This is perfect for a good chuckle in the midst of a diaper change. They also have the yellow strip that changes colors to let you know when baby has a wet diaper.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Very good diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2019
reviews.review: These are soft and almost clothlike. The fit is what you expect with plenty of stretch for the tabs to fasten. There was no chaffing at the legs or waist and the absorbancy was spot on.

reviews.name: L Parr
reviews.title: Great price alternative to the name brands!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2019
reviews.review: Great price alternative to the name brands! This brand for sensitive skin passed all of the tests against the Huggies sensitive diapers and came out ahead. For the price it’s a no brainer.

reviews.name: Joseph
reviews.title: Great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
reviews.review: Great diapers. They are soft, comfortable, absorbent and haven't caused any rashes or leaks. Seems like a quality brand.

reviews.name: The Anti Bridezilla
reviews.title: A great alternative to Pampers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.review: Normally I prefer pampers as they're the only diapers that don't leave my daughter's skin irritated if I accidentally go a little too long between changes. But these are awesome. I bought them, a little skeptically as a good backup option for when my pampers run out. But even though they're a tad large, they work like a charm — even for the overnight diaper.

reviews.name: Workin’ Mom
reviews.title: Excellent Disposable Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers fit great and don't leak.

reviews.name: Johnny
reviews.title: A beautiful package for your baby bundle
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
reviews.review: We can’t speak to the “old” design but are really impressed. You are bound to hear some crying so you’ll have to decide if they are tears of joy at these stylish and whimsical diapers from Parasol. We think YES! Fairly priced and they are softies, too.

reviews.name: Asma Barakat
reviews.title: Soft and absorbs and dry
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
reviews.review: Good material and quality it is very comfortable and absorb well

reviews.name: JLF
reviews.title: Nicest quality diaper...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2020
reviews.review:
This is probably the nicest quality diaper I've ever used before. That said, the price point reflects that. If you have issues with reactions, this diaper is a good solution. They are very soft, not irritating at all and you do get alot of diapers. Overall, pleased with the quality and design of the diaper. Just not super affordable.

*If this review made a difference for you, please let me know and click the "HELPFUL" button.

reviews.name: S B
reviews.title: A good diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
reviews.review: We’ve had good luck with these diapers for nighttime and daytime use on our son. He’s 3.5 so he fills a diaper a lot, and these only leaked once! They feel sturdier than other all natural diapers. We use them at home and daycare, so one leak is pretty impressive. They did not irritate our son at all. Our one issue was the straps that stick to hold it on can be kind of tricky to pull apart sometimes, very secure!

reviews.name: Kay C
reviews.title: Soft and Strong
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020
reviews.review: Love them! They're super soft and doing great with holding in runny poop!

reviews.name: Mia
reviews.title: Soft and absorbent diapers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2019
reviews.review:
This is one of my favorite diapers, really soft and absorbent. Good quality.
Cute design.

reviews.name: Catrina Thomas
reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019
reviews.review: These diapers work great, just as good as any other name brand diaper. And they're super cute, too. I would highly recommend them!!

reviews.name: Ana Figueroa Ramos
reviews.title: Quality without fragrance or chemicals.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
reviews.review: When I see something that is really good, I definitely give it the 5 stars and this cover for the Nintendo Switch is worth it. Its interior is in velvet which makes it look elegant and spreads equipment. It has many compartments for my games and I can put it horizontally comfortably while traveling. Recommended

reviews.name: A
reviews.title: Love these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2019
reviews.review: These are really absorbent and soft, cute packaging and value for quantity if great!

reviews.name: Workin’ Mom
reviews.title: Excellent Disposable Diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers fit great and don't leak.

reviews.name: Johnny
reviews.title: A beautiful package for your baby bundle
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
reviews.review: We can’t speak to the “old” design but are really impressed. You are bound to hear some crying so you’ll have to decide if they are tears of joy at these stylish and whimsical diapers from Parasol. We think YES! Fairly priced and they are softies, too.

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.title: Absorbency
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are very absorbent. They are super soft and comfortable for baby! Only downside as we found they are not great for blowouts. They’re also pretty expensive.

reviews.name: Diana
reviews.title: Overall satisfaced
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are cute and functional.. only thing i would love to be different is better fitting. The diaper covers perfectly the bum but the sides are kinda short making a no ideal fitting

reviews.name: Natalie M.
reviews.title: New design is a huge improvement
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2021
reviews.review:
I stopped using Parasol around 2019 when they changed the design to tacky, terrible prints. I just ordered a few weeks ago and can confirm the diapers you get from amazon are the new adorable design with big improvements including the pee indicator line and better waist elastic.

I had been using Parasol since 2017 with my first and was really disappointed when they changed. Recently got an ad and saw they had reverted to super cute patterns and thought I'd give them a chance again. The new design is super soft, they hold well even overnight and have good fit for my second. During the interim I tried pampers and hello bello and I can tell the fit is greatly improved with parasol. The elastic area aroudn the waist actually stretches and the diapers don't sag like hello bello ones.

Love the black and white new prints with the leaves and puppies. I like that they're unisex and minimal but I do wish there were more patterns to pick from.

reviews.name: KR
reviews.title: Miss the Old Version
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
reviews.review: Slightly disappointed with the new design. I loved the older version but felt like these didn’t absorb the best for overnight use. I did reach out to the company and they mentioned it could be due to size as these “run small” which didn’t seem the case per the sizing guidelines. I would say that some worked better then others but overall during the day they held up well and we had no leaks or explosions. The only issue I had was with overnight wear we had a couple leaks since my son is at the higher end we’ll give the pull up version a try.

reviews.name: Great Books
reviews.title: New design has me reconsidering this brand unless they bring back their old design.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2019
reviews.product_specs: Size: Size 4 (96 Count)Color: Born to Run
reviews.review: I agree with the other recent reviews. These pull up diapers used to be 5 stars and I swore by them. This new design is lacking in so many ways and Is making me regret not stocking up before. They are still super soft which is great but they do rip too easy, and I also find that they aren’t as absorbent and dry as before. I have even had a few leaks at night. Other times i find when I change a night diaper that’s super full my baby feels really damp. He has started getting rashes for the first time since using this brand. Please bring the old design back!

reviews.name: Rodney
reviews.title: Bring the old design back
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020
reviews.review:
I’m really sad that parasol changed their diapers. My daughter has been in parasol diapers for a year, they were the BEST diapers. These new ones are so ugly, much smaller, not as soft. I am giving 4 stars because I will probably continue to use these for my baby until she potty trains and they are still better than most brands. But I am very disappointed.

You might need to size up from your previous size if you are used to the old design.

reviews.name: Jaspreet
reviews.title: Love the dryness shield
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
reviews.review: Really like the diapers most very soft diapers I have ever used for my 3 months old son.

reviews.name: Anita
reviews.title: Locks away moisture dry skin for 13 hours
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
reviews.review: Received as a sample in our baby registry gift bag. Our son is six weeks old wearing a size one diaper, we normally cloth diaper. However, we have been experiencing leaks overnight as our baby can’t sleep thru the night he nurses but don’t necessarily wake to be changed, one diaper lasted up to 13 hours without having to be changed. Yes, we fed him. Yes we burped him but we did not have to change the diaper because he was dry on the outside, this was a test and absolute test to see just how long this diaper would last and just how long his skin would stay dry. I am highly surprised that his skin was dry after 13 hours in this diaper from 10 PM to 1 PM the next day then we put the second diaper on him that came in the pack at 1 PM and change that one at 9 PM. Still dry to the touch his skin dry and I am highly impressed with these diapers. I wish I could afford them. I would love to try them when he has a rash to see if it would help get rid of it YES I recommend and would buy these diapers again and I may in the future but for now we’re sticking to cloth diapers

reviews.name: PattyT
reviews.title: Super soft! Good diapers but run just a bit big.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
reviews.review:
My nephew and his wife have two little ones in diapers so I thought they might like to try this brand to see if they liked them more than the Huggies they currently use. The diapers are very cute with the designs on the bum. They are also very soft. I was amazed at just how soft they were. My kids are adults and disposable diapers felt like sandpaper compared to these. They have a wetness indicator which, to me, is a must.

I originally chose these for the little one but they run somewhat big and a bit wide and fit the older one who is about 4 pounds over the weight limit printed on the packaging. They absorb daytime wetness well but there is a little gap that allows some leakage at night when he is sleeping. They use these during the day and rarely have leakage issues. The diapers don't cause irritation and easy to put on and take off. The designs are really adorable and unisex. If the sizing were accurate and they didn't have a bit of a leakage issue at night, these would be the best diapers my nephew and his wife have tried they told me. But they are sticking to other brands at night and using these during the day along with some cheaper brands. These are quite expensive so they can't afford to switch completely.

These diapers are definitely unique and pretty absorbent. Definitely very, very soft. Well made in most ways. Well worth a try if your baby has sensitive skin or you are looking for a softer, cuter alternative. If your child is on the low end of the size chart, I would go down a size for a more secure fit.

reviews.name: The Girl Utah
reviews.title: Truly, a designer diaper.. 100%
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
reviews.review:
This is 1 of 2 pks of diapers I ordered in 2 diff. brands while helping care for a newborn. After being out of “Baby game” almost 2 decades, I was shocked how many new choices are out there..!! PARASOL Diapers in itself is a new brand to me-
I’m happy to report it was a quality and decent brand For approx. $36 per case.
As mentioned our baby watching was that of a newborn who’s just moving from newborn sizing.. So, we ordered this in size 2. (Baby still is just a eat/sleep/poop little peanut- no crawling/walking wiggling yet..!! So, can’t comment on how it holds up with activity-) As for newborn phase, these worked fantastically.. I loved the feel- somehow they’ve created a soft as cloth material.. in a disposable diaper.. even crazier, are the grip tabs- we are talking VooDoo magic! It states these are silent tabs and they pretty much are!!! Why would this matter?? If, ever you’ve had to change a sleeping baby… Then, you know!! Every noise can startle/wake them, and this was crazy quiet!
As for containment they did fabulous- we had no blowouts or leaks.. that is rare for any brand!
Cutest part of all- these truly are designer diapers! On the bottom of the diaper is a tag line saying or, designer Jean image… OMG!! Yes, it’s a novelty- but, why not??? Everyone that saw this was completely smitten with the idea.
These could be given at a baby shower and get any parent excited for their new arrival- all while being the hit of the gifting..!! I’ve never seen this- and trust me, in cuteness + quality arena.. these surpassed all expectations. I’d order again without hesitation..

reviews.name: Booknerd28
reviews.title: Performs well, but I'll pass
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
reviews.review:
These diapers just aren't for us. We'll be sticking with huggies little snugglers

Pros:
1) pee wetness indicator
2) sizing was fairly acurate
2) cute designs
3) Stretchy top waist band for better fit and to keep blowouts contained.
4) Inside is soft and was good for sensitive skin (no rash and she's very sensitive)

cons:
1) too thin and not absorbent enough. I would not recommend these for overnight.
2) The packaging is ridiculous. It comes in a thick tarp-like bag that does not have perforated line on the top like most brands. It took me a solid 5 minutes to figure out how to rip the side seam open....so not good if you're in the middle of a change and realize you're out of diapers at the changing table and have a baby you're trying to quickly rediaper before they pee everywhere.
Also, this comes in a bag, in a "cute" box from the company, all inside of an amazon box. This is just wasteful. I mean, other companies do that too with big packages (with several sleeves in it, but those sleeves are thin and clear. This was brand tarp sleeve, then brand box).

Side wall protection is just so so.

Overall, these are decent, but for the price and performance, we'll stick with huggies little snugglers and little movers.

reviews.name: Editor of Lillian's Diaries
reviews.title: Soft and Unique
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020
reviews.review: Parasol Clear+Dry Disposable Diapers are unique starting with the strong texture with black and white decor on the bag in which the diapers come. The diapers are a plain white with a little "See You At 2:00 AM " written on the front of the diaper in black and others that have a black outline drawing of pockets and zipper at the top of the diaper. The diaper is made of non-woven fabric of chlorine-free wood pulp. Polypropylene non-woven fabric, super absorbent polymer and polyethylene film. It is silky soft on both the inside and and outside of the diaper and there is no smell. The ones I am reviewing are a size 3 which is for babies 16-26 or 28 depending where you are reading about the poundage. The waistline as an elastic band which feels a little tight to me but it will definitely keep the diaper in place. The elastic leg cuffs are a little less tight. Parosol states that their diapers will not be made with chlorine, alcohol, dyes, chemical, fragrances, lotion, Parabens, preservatives, or latex. These diapers do seem to keep the wetness away from the baby. My one concern is the tab that holds the diaper in place does not stick to the diaper all the way to the end of the tab and a baby could catch the loose end of the tab and open up the diaper.

reviews.name: Frank A
reviews.title: Another nice natural alternative
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2019
reviews.review: I must begin this review by saying, I haven't tried these diapers on my grandbaby yet because she hasn't arrived yet. I am stocking up and preparing for her arrival. I ordered these diapers for her because I prefer a more natural diaper so these seemed right up my alley. I've used wood pulp based diapers with my other grandbaby and had good luck. So it gave me the confidence to order these. When I took the package out of the box I was surprised how compact all the diapers were in their plastic covering. Which is great because it makes them easier to store. The plastic covering makes you feel kinda fancy with the print and the texture. When I opened the diapers I noticed how soft the diapers were. They seemed comfy cozy for a new baby. They don't have a strong chemically odor like some diapers do. It's so nice NOT to smell baby powdered diapers. I can't stand a coverup smell for babies. Once my grandbaby arrives and I have tried the diapers on her, I will come back to update as best as I can! Happy Diapering!

reviews.name: LifePathin4D
reviews.title: Great for cute pics! Absorbent too!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
reviews.review:
Adorable as can be! There is nothing cuter than a baby wearing these diapers, perfect to wear for a little photo shoot with these cute sayings. Any new mom would be thrilled to get a pack of these diapers.

They are absorbent and soft just like you would expect and they are as good as any diaper you will find but I do have one thing I saw that I can complain about, if a chunkier baby is wearing them, they are kind of tight on the legs. I have several babies in my life and I keep diapers in the house and these are very well liked except by the mom with the extra chunky baby, she likes them but they are just too tight for the baby in the leg area with the way they are made. For girls and boys I highly recommend them and they have a 5 star cuteness factor and an overall 4 star review.

reviews.name: Mimi
reviews.title: soft diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
reviews.review: I used Parasol diapers a few years ago and they were a lot different. I feel like they took what customers suggested and changed some aspects of their diapers. I liked the old prints on the diapers better, as they were fun and colorful. The new print however would probably show through less lighter colored clothing. The waistand is much more snug than the old design, and is even smaller than other size 5 diapers we've been using. They still fit my toddler, but I'd just noticed they were snugger. I'm guessing this is to prevent blowouts in the smaller sizes. I feel like they don't need this as much with the older sizes. Also, there should be more prints for the older sizes since I sure hope that I don't "see you at 2 am" which is printed on the back of the diaper. With all of these thoughts....I still am impressed overall with this diaper. They hold up to the job and I don't have any complaints with performance or skin irritation, etc. I do like the greener thumbprint and where the company is trying to help the environment.

reviews.name: Parker-Moore and Family
reviews.title: Pricey diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
reviews.review: At $0.56 per diaper, they are undoubtedly the most expensive ones we have tried. We typically use either Seventh Generation ($0.37 per diaper) or our new favorite Amazon Brand ($0.27), and occasionally Huggies ($0.23). They fit well, he’s 9 months in a size 3 (bottom heavy) and the diapers are very thick. First night, no leaks and there was a blue line that indicated he had a wet diaper and his skin was dry. The 128 count package is slightly cheaper at $0.54 per diaper. We have not had any case of diaper rash with this baby, but we did with the last one.

reviews.name: M Jay
reviews.title: Incredible but too expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2019
reviews.review:
So I have a lot to say about these.
-first off WOW. They have in this crazy packaging that alone feels really really expensive.
-they are by far the softest diapers ever. They come close to the feel of pampers pure but these are doubled in softness from even those.
-cutest little design on the butt
-good absorbency

However
-these are insanely expensive, I started using pampers, these are more expensive than pampers and I’m not familiar with this brand. I now use the amazon brand diapers which I’m so obsessed with. I love them more than pampers. These diapers are DOUBLE the price of the amazon brand.
-that’s the only reason I gave this 4 stars, too expensive. But for some this might be the perfect diaper if money is not an issue.

reviews.name: Cat, Chris and Family
reviews.title: Decent; Adorable Design
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
reviews.review:
I absolutely love the "see you at 2 o'clock a.m." design on the back of these diapers. Truer words have never been spoken when you have a newborn! I thought it was adorable.

This are definitely the most soft diapers I've used when it comes to disposables. Most other diapers I have used have had more of a rough plasticky feel to them that don't allow air in and are not breathable. These are definitely more breathable than the store bought ones I usually use. I am magine they are more comfortable for baby as well.

As far as absorbency, these don't offer as much protection as others I have used in the past. They tend to leak through with heavy wetters.

reviews.name: Steel City Adventure Cats
reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2019
reviews.review:
The only reason I deducted a star is because I feel the sizing is slightly off. The leg holes are tight while the rest is wide, they just seem awkwardly sized.
BUT, other than that I absolutely love these diapers. They are the softest I've ever felt, and we have tried nearly every diaper under the sun. They hold up throughout the night, even with heavy wetters, and to boot they are just so darn cute! I love the "see you at 2am" and jean pocket designs.
I love that these are more natural and that the company stays away from using harsh chemicals. Our little one has sensitive skin and is prone to rashes but we've had no issues while using these diapers!

reviews.name: Natasha Galbreath
reviews.title: Adorable Diapers that work
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are so stinking adorable! They have the standard line on them as well, to help tell when baby is wet. When first out of the package I was kind of worried because they felt kind of thin. Soft, but thin. Its a weird combination. BUt they held a lot of liquid and didnt leak. And they didnt sag or get all bunched up at the bottom either. Surprising! I do think the tabs could hold a bit stronger, but thats not a deal breaker. Even wet they didnt leave a wet feeling against skin. And there is NO scent added, thank you! Diapers dont need scents, its terrible for baby skin (and ours too!) THe biggest downside is the cost of these. At roughly 50c per size 2 diaper, thats way more than I generally pay for diapers.

reviews.name: TheMysteriousLibra
reviews.title: Feels just like cloth and runs a little big
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
reviews.review: I gave these as a gift to some new parents and the response I got back from them is that they love how these feel more than any of the other brands they’ve tried. The fabric is soft and that makes them feel better about what they are putting on their infants body. The fit was a little big for their daughter, even though she’s within the 7-14 lb range, she is just small and these weren’t quite fitting her snug enough. Because of that there was a little leakage so they plan to wait until she gets a little bigger and start using these because they love the cloth feeling.

reviews.name: The Indie Reviewer
reviews.title: Fighting rashes with softness
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
reviews.review: Diaper rashes are a common, yet painful situation for both the baby and parent. The key is usually breathability to cure, and these diapers tout that. They have rash shield protection, and they indeed come in a disposable material that attracts wetness to keep it from rubbing on the baby. What’s more, these diapers have no chlorine, parabens, fragrances, chemicals, latex, etc. which really pushes them above the competition in eco-friendliness. Many reviews knocked points for flimsy sides and the leakage. So much of that depends on the size and use of the baby, so in our case, it’s been worth trying in the specific case of aiding a diaper rash. Still, considering those quirks, we definitely recommend trying them in the special case of a diaper rash, which is what these are tailor-made for.

reviews.name: Emily Paine
reviews.title: Runs big but ultra soft!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
reviews.review: These diapers are really cute and really soft. They come with two designs, one that says, " See you at 2 am." And the other has a design to look like little Jean's I'm the front and back. They inside is super soft and has what they call a rash shield layer that help's wixknthe moisture off of baby's skin and reduce the risk of rashes. Which we haven't seen a rash yet! They're also more earth friendly, staying away from chemicals and fragrances, parabens, etc. The only thing that I think people would find frustrating is that the sizing it a bit awkward, it's not awful but they definitely run big, and kind of wide. Still made of great things though!

reviews.name: Shaun Tabatt
reviews.title: Great natural diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2020
reviews.review: I really liked these diapers for my son. They absorbed well even at night and were easy to get on and off. The tabs worked great over and over when needing adjustment. The dryness indicator worked well for my boy. The fabric is definitely breathable. There is no discernible fragrance or chemical smell. This is VERY important to me. The diapers are quite thin but great for absorbency. Overall, I am extremely pleased with these naturally-minded diapers. If I had the resources to invest in more expensive diapers, I would continue to purchase these.

reviews.name: Sailor
reviews.title: Much better than the pull-up version
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020
reviews.review:
I recently tried the pull-up version of these as well and HATED them. I am happy to report these are a lot better. These aren't too far off from what you'd expect from Pampers. I like the addition of the cute little prints. The velcro tabs on these don't seem as secure as other brands, I'm a little scared to try these for a nap or night time when I know I'll be greeted in the am with a poopy diaper.
We've used them throughout the day for just pee diapers and they seem to do the trick.

reviews.name: robochick
reviews.title: Cute, soft and thin diapers, but still works great 👍
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2020
reviews.review:
Unless I opened the bag upside down I didn’t think I did since it was perforated to open where I did. The diapers should be with the smooth side up so you easily grab. I sort of chuckled at these diapers as they are mike wearing jeans. They are cute on and at first I thought wow these feel thin, but they are soft and we didn’t have any blow outs so it’s a win especially being more natural diapers.

If you find my review helpful please select the helpful button below. Thanks!

reviews.name: Auburn
reviews.title: Simple diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019
reviews.review:
I was skeptical when I put this on my kids butt. There are wings on the side that stick out pretty far. So far there haven't been any leaks.
The diaper itself is super soft and doesn't irritate the skin. Simple in design without lots of designs.
I doubt I would test this for a long haul diaper but for a short duration during the day.

reviews.name: Bros
reviews.title: Decent!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
reviews.review: We tested these Clear+Dry on my grand daughter. She liked them.They are very soft. They stay secure but not as secure as Pampers or Huggies imo. We saw some sagging with minimal #1 and #2 accumulation. They have no odor which is a plus and seem to be chemical free. These diapers collect moisture OK. The wicking could be better. We didn't notice any leaking. Also, NO RASH at all. Overall these are good every day diapers. Are they better than other leading brands NO but they are competitive in quality and price. 4 stars.

reviews.name: 💚TosaT💚
reviews.title: Sizing inconsistencies
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are really soft and fit very well. No baby but rash which is a wonderful thing. These diapers are also eco-friendly which is good for the environment. The only thing I don’t like about these diapers is the sizing. Even on their listing page, they list different weights in different spots. In the description title it gives one weight range. Further down the page it gives a different weight range for the same size. So just be really careful to get the right size. I would use the sizing on the bag

reviews.name: Erica K
reviews.title: Really soft.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
reviews.review: I really wanted to love these parasol diapers. They really are so soft that it made a great impression. However there were some negatives for me. I wish where the tabs are were loner. They have zero stretch to them and don't come around nearly where I would like to put them on the waist. These are really long. My son normally wears a 5 in other brands, but could of worn a 4 comfortably in these. I never had a blowout in these so I was definitely impressed with that. I really loved the simple design on these.

reviews.name: It works!
reviews.title: I can't say I love them but they are decent!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2019
reviews.review: I love what the company stand for and the design aspect of this. It is really soft and feels expansive for disposable diaper if that makes any sense. lol It does not absorb and stay dry as well as other brand names but this is great pack to have handy at home. I mean, it's so cute too! If I had to pick, it's compatible to the Honest kids in my opinion.

reviews.name: R+L HOME
reviews.title: Nice quality!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
reviews.review: I really like these diapers! They are very soft and wonderful for sensitive skin. I especially love that there is zero scent to the fibers of these diapers even when first opening a fresh package. The patterns are simple and adorable. The absorbency is not the best I’ve experienced. Using them for heavy overnight use is going to be nearly impossible. For the quality, I don’t necessarily mind that. But, the convenience factor is going to be less than that of other brands.

reviews.name: comp_g33k
reviews.title: Decent diapers, but high price to pay.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020
reviews.review: The diapers are very soft to the touch - but they are a little pricier than what I'm used to. They don't look or feel particularly premium and would make a great gift, but unless your child has a need for softer diapers than usual, I wouldn't see the need for these. It's a very simple design/pattern, so nothing particularly fun or exciting.

reviews.name: Mom who bakes
reviews.title: Super soft! Overpriced..
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
reviews.review: I was completely shocked with how soft these diapers were upon opening the package. They fit my baby well, no issues there. They are on the thin size so absorbency will always worry me. They are extremely expensive for what you get. I think if you are looking for a more 'green' environmental friendly diaper you can make this work, but these diapers are not worth the cost in my opinion.

reviews.name: GustyGardener
reviews.title: Super soft diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are surprisingly soft to the touch. They fit my baby well and the pull tabs hold together strongly. We don't need anything hypoallergenic so I can't speak to that feature, but it does feel like it would be soft and comfortable on irritated skin. The price is a bit high for these diapers, but if you are looking for their special features, it is worth a shot.

reviews.name: M
reviews.title: Made in China
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2019
reviews.review: 80 count size one diapers. Made in China. That always makes me worry about quality. So far the diapers are holding up well but have a funny smell. Stay tune for updates

reviews.name: annie
reviews.title: Soft & Comfy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2019
reviews.review: These diapers are soft and yet absorbent. I think they run a little on the large side.

reviews.name: AmazonMadeInChina
reviews.title: So cute!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2019
reviews.review: The are hands down the cutest diapers I have ever used. They are fairly absorbant. They haven’t caused any rash or any of skin issues. I love these!

reviews.name: Dracaena Trifasciata
reviews.title: Soft diapers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are soft and get the job done. They are great for daytime use and seems to do a good job of absorbing wetness. They are not irritating but do seem to run a tad large. I would not use these for overnights but they are a great diaper for those times when you are doing frequent changes.

reviews.name: Lady_S
reviews.title: Good enough
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
reviews.review: Cute designs, soft, absorbent, no signs of skin rash/allergies, no leakage either and the diapers fit better than expected. So far so good.

reviews.name: MyOhMy
reviews.title: May be better for you than for me
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
reviews.review: We generally use cloth diapers but thought we’d give these a try during a trip. They seemed to work fine and I expect if you are used to disposable diapers they would be okay but I’m staying with cloth.

reviews.name: CHRISSIE
reviews.title: pretty good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
reviews.review: just started using these diapers and they work well they are not as thick as huggies diapers but they still hold well baby seems comfortable no irritations along diapers edges on babies skin. keeps babies skin dry and soaks up urine and contains the poop well. i had isssues with pampers cause the poop kept coming out the back but not with this pacl very good i would reccomend them

reviews.name: Erin Penn
reviews.title: Cute Design
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
reviews.review: Love the cute designs which appear on the diaper. Nice and soft, and less rash issues using this brand.. Only problem is the absorbency is not up to what is needed for night.

reviews.name: Reviewer
reviews.title: Good - no issues.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2021
reviews.review:
Well made, quality construction with good quality materials.

We’ve been happy with performance/value.

reviews.name: Chris J. Bartel
reviews.title: Good quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019
reviews.review: Good quality

reviews.name: KPITT
reviews.title: Super soft and absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
reviews.review: These are great diapers! I would say the are comprable to pampers and I actually love the waist on these - they are gathered with goes with my sons body for when he rolls allover the place. They are super absorbent and soft and they side tabs really hold - my 5 month moves around a lot so having a diaper that stays in place is awesome!

reviews.name: AmazingGrace
reviews.title: Cute diapers!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
reviews.review: These Clear and Dry Disposable diapers are amazingly soft and lightweight. I don’t think I’ve ever purchased a softer diaper. Diaper seems to work great with sensitive skin. I have used other diapers that are more absorbent, but for the cost, I think these diapers are still a great value. The little sayings and designs on these diapers are super cute too! Overall, I recommend these diapers!

reviews.name: Ma'ama
reviews.title: Moisture wicking and soft diapers for sensitive skin.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
reviews.review: My baby is prone to getting severe diaper rashes that come on quickly and are painful. These diapers are very soft and do not further irritate my little one’s sensitive skin. These are moisture wicking and help to keep the area dry, reducing diaper rashes.

reviews.name: Monet Sathre
reviews.title: Great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
reviews.review: Nice diapers for my little one. They were soft on the skin and I found the absorbance to be good. I do think you have to change these more than huggies which are the best absorbance. Overall these are nice but do come at a higher price point.

reviews.name: Ann Neris
reviews.title: Work as promised
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
reviews.review: So far no rash n they work well, they absorb as needed and they stay in place. No complains and I like the drowning and design.

reviews.name: I'mTheHairLady
reviews.title: So far, so good.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.review: I can't say that these beat our favorite name brand, but they seem pretty nice so far!

reviews.name: CoCo's Mom
reviews.title: Not all diapers are the same
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2019
reviews.review: These diapers are special. They feel so soft. They are absorbant and they fit newborns like they should. These are not for preemies. They will fit 7-14 pound babies. This is actually nice, because you will get more than a couple of weeks out of these. And the diapers are better than most for the environment. Their environmental footprint is much smaller. You can even use the bag they come in to carry other items around.

reviews.name: Oceania
reviews.title: Just okay
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
reviews.review: I love the softness of these, but the tabs are pretty old-school and small and the fit is tight.

reviews.name: Bethany
reviews.title: Wonderful but expensive
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
reviews.review: These are superb diapers. They’re amazingly soft and super absorbent. I think they work even better than the name brand diapers we’ve tried. They have the double elastic parts around the legs, which definitely prevent blow outs. My only hang up is the price, almost twice as much as the name brand ones... They are a little expensive... but they are natural and free of chemicals, which is also a huge plus.

reviews.name: DS
reviews.title: Great for sensitive bun buns. Very soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2020
reviews.review:
Really great product for kids with sensitive skin. Well made and great absorbency. Very very soooft :)

Recommend

reviews.name: Monet Sathre
reviews.title: Great diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
reviews.review: Nice diapers for my little one. They were soft on the skin and I found the absorbance to be good. I do think you have to change these more than huggies which are the best absorbance. Overall these are nice but do come at a higher price point.

reviews.name: Ann Neris
reviews.title: Work as promised
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020
reviews.review: So far no rash n they work well, they absorb as needed and they stay in place. No complains and I like the drowning and design.

reviews.name: I'mTheHairLady
reviews.title: So far, so good.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.review: I can't say that these beat our favorite name brand, but they seem pretty nice so far!

reviews.name: Courtney
reviews.title: Wanted to love
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2024
reviews.review: I wanted to love these. They are very very soft! The sizing is odd….the leg holes are huge and waist is skinny. My 17 month old is 24lbs very lean and she would need a size 3 for legs and a size 5 for waist.

reviews.name: Yana Abushynava
reviews.title: have leakage
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
reviews.review: At first I thought these were very comfortable diapers, they were very soft. but as practice has shown, they get through

reviews.name: ku’uipo Taketa
reviews.title: Super soft but
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.review: I recently bought these diapers for my son who has very sensitive skin they are so soft, unfortunately he still gets rashes but not as bad as when he was using other diaper brands. Will not be purchasing again due to the constant over night leakage.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Every other diaper is broken
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2024
reviews.review: I do love this product very much,but unfortunately every other diaper is braking…

reviews.name: Alison Sipos
reviews.title: They’re okay.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.review: These are soft of the outside. The fit is not good, it’s too tight around the legs and way too loose around the waist. These are good in a pinch.

reviews.name: Erica Loftin
reviews.title: New version isn’t made well like the older version.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2019
reviews.product_specs: Size: Size 4 (96 Count)Color: Born to Run
reviews.review: I have used parasol diapers on my daughter since birth, and have always loved them. Until now. They changed the pull ups and they are sooo thin now, so thin that you can’t even pull them up on your kid with put the sides ripping. These aren’t cheap diapers so for them to rip and be wasted and thrown away unused is ridiculous! The strip pad on the inside is very small now and not as wide and gives her a wedgy every time. So disappointed in the change.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Size up
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2022
reviews.review: They ran way smaller compared to his normal diaper pamper swaddlers. I opened it only used a few and now I just have an entire pack opened I can't use. So if your gonna order them order the next size up

reviews.name: Baby mom
reviews.title: Runs smaller than sizing says
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2021
reviews.review: Unfortunately we followed the size chart and got size 2 for my 15lb daughter. They’re too short and we need size 3. They’re so expensive I’m disappointed that we have to waste a whole bag. Especially because we followed their sizing recommendations.

reviews.name: AK
reviews.title: The softest so far but not that absorbent
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
reviews.review:
Like them from the packaging. Very soft although they kinda feel like not very fabric-ky feeling. Appreciate they have the yellow line for pee. But it does not hold everything! We've been having accidents from everywhere :S
Their design is fun though :D

reviews.name: SoCal_living
reviews.title: New Design Quality Not the Same
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
reviews.product_specs: Size: Size 4 (48 Count)Color: Born to Run
reviews.review: The ‘Born to Run’ quality just not the same as the ‘DESERT SPRING’ diaper pants we used to love. This re-design isn’t working for us since we had multiple leaks and noticed the material isn’t as absorbent. Sadly we are switching to another brand.

reviews.name: Mabel T.
reviews.title: Old version is better
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
reviews.review: We have been using the old version since our baby was 2 months old. The old version worked great for us. I’m not sure why they had to go and ruin a good thing. We recently received the new version in size 3 and they just aren’t as good. The new version feels thinner and less soft. The new elastic waist band is not as good. The old version waist band helped prevent blowouts. Since using the new version we are dealing with blowouts again. Once we are done with this box I’ll be switching to Freestyle diapers.

reviews.name: Heather LaRee
reviews.title: Soft & THE BEST Design, But Not The Best To Ensure No Leaks.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
reviews.review:
Great for baby boy's early baby stages.
They were soft and mostly kept him dry and skin clear from irritation.
Always appreciate the "wet" indicator & Zero Fragrance.
Love the simple design and sweet design above all other diapers!
But, can't give them 5 stars as there were some leaks compared to other brands I used.

reviews.name: Samantha
reviews.title: Very soft but leaves clothing feeling wet.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019
reviews.review: Absolutely adorable designs and truly some of the softest diapers I’ve ever used. Our daughter recently moved up to size 1 diapers (almost 11 lbs) and these diapers are supposed to fit from 7-14 lbs (they wouldn’t fit her at birth (8 lbs 12 ozs). They do fit now however I’ve noticed they are quite a bit wider between the legs than most size 1, however the length from front to back is similar. They seem to be absorbent and we haven’t had any actual leaks yet however when my daughter urinates the butt of her sleepers feel like they are wet, not actual leaking but it’s like you can feel the pee threw the clothing (only after 1 pee, not even a fully saturated diaper).

reviews.name: Nikki
reviews.title: Clear and Dry diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
reviews.review: Clear+Dry size 4 diapers. These are a white cotton weave and nice and soft. They are just ok. I didn't feel they were as absorbent as other brands. They are thin and have no padding at all. These diapers didn't irritate the skin or cause rashes. These were best for daytime use only if you have to use them. They are hypoallergenic.

reviews.name: Shelly Hammond
reviews.title: Not great for travel
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020
reviews.review:
These are okay diapers. They work great in a jam! I just really wouldn't recommend these for travel times, which is where the leaking occurred for me. These diapers seemed to feel wetter much faster than other brands and if not changed super fast they did leak a bit. Not a ton but enough to be noticeable and frustrating. You know how you get that little bit of leakage around the legs so you have to full outfit change and car seat cover wash? Like that. However, if you aren't traveling and can get in there and get the diapers faster you should be okay.
As for everything else they were good. They did absorb pretty good and they didn't cause any rashes or anything.

reviews.name: Rebecca
reviews.title: not that impressed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
reviews.review: The tabs don't stretch and the diapers aren't very soft. They are cute, and come in cute packaging and absorb well enough, and fit fine.

reviews.name: Jen C.
reviews.title: Purchase them for the cute designs alone
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
reviews.review: Let's be honest - you are buying these diapers for the super cute designs. And there is nothing wrong with that! I love the adorable pockets and cute saying on the bootie. However, these are not the best diapers in the world. I have found cheaper options that are much better at leak protection. You are paying for the designs and the "nature-friendly" product quality. So, if these things matter to you, then go for it! Or if you are looking for someone else, I think these would be an awesome baby shower gift.

reviews.name: Aalea1
reviews.title: Small
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
reviews.review: These size 2 are equal , if not smaller in size to Pampers size one. Check the weights before ordering. I find them cute, the prints are dark and distinctive but they are thin. They'll do in a crunch but I'm finding overnight is a challenge. They have the potential to be a really good diaper, needs a little more thoughtful work.

reviews.name: Liz
reviews.title: they’re ok
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are ok. They fit on the small side and tend to leak around the legs but they seem comfortable and don’t cause rashes.

reviews.name: Paigii
reviews.title: large and not absorbent but cute
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are SO cute but they are not super absorbent. I find that "things" tend to slip through the leg holes as they arent very fitted....

reviews.name: Michael
reviews.title: not as good as the normal name brands
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
reviews.review: Our newest is our fifth baby, so we've had experience with diapers. We've had middling luck with parasol. Sometimes they've worked pretty good and sometimes they've been ok. They don't seem to hold as much as the normal name brand diapers and the fit isn't as good either. I'm not sure why I would pay the price for what act like mid-quality diapers! It's also hilarious that some of the diapers say "see you at 2am". Are you really advertising that your diapers don't last the night?

reviews.name: Margaret P.
reviews.title: Not for overnight use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are thin and not extremely absorbent compared to others, even some store brand generics. They fit well but will still leak if used overnight or if changing is delayed during the day. The adhesive tabs are just so-so.

reviews.name: LizardLvr
reviews.title: Cute design. Poor absorbency.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
