reviews.review: The design is adorable! However, absorbency is what we need and these diapers do not stand up against the name brands. They are thin and can be used during the day, but we were not willing to wait and see the results at 2am. So, as a daytime diaper, these are okay.

reviews.name: L
reviews.title: Chinese made eco diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020
reviews.review: This are very mediocre diapers, hands down for eco friendly but these are Chinese made and I’m personally only trust usa made diapers because I know what’s in them for sure. This product isn’t bad, but I usually go they 7-9 a day which is not cost effective especially if you are on tight budget. Again, love that they are eco friendly, dislike poor absorbency, value for the $ and the fact it’s made in China.

reviews.name: loveguitar
reviews.title: Good but Thin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
reviews.review: These nappies are thin and not thick like Pampers. I would not trust these to keep a baby dry all night, much less contain a poop explosion. But, they are fine for daytime use when you can check more frequently on conditions. They go on just like any other diaper, and I think would be good to keep in a diaper bag as back up if you run out of your regular diapers.

reviews.name: Zü
reviews.title: Cute design, run large
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2019
reviews.review: These diapers are very cute: they come in two designs ("jean" pockets and "see you at 2 am"), and are soft, however they are wider than expected and run large overall.

reviews.name: Dee
reviews.title: Clean but overnight lacks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2022
reviews.review: I like that they’re a cleaner diaper in terms of chemicals and very soft. However, my baby sleeps decent over night and by morning the bed/her clothes are moist.

reviews.name: Aalea1
reviews.title: Small
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
reviews.review: These size 2 are equal , if not smaller in size to Pampers size one. Check the weights before ordering. I find them cute, the prints are dark and distinctive but they are thin. They'll do in a crunch but I'm finding overnight is a challenge. They have the potential to be a really good diaper, needs a little more thoughtful work.

reviews.name: Liz
reviews.title: they’re ok
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are ok. They fit on the small side and tend to leak around the legs but they seem comfortable and don’t cause rashes.

reviews.name: Paigii
reviews.title: large and not absorbent but cute
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are SO cute but they are not super absorbent. I find that "things" tend to slip through the leg holes as they arent very fitted....

reviews.name: Michael
reviews.title: not as good as the normal name brands
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020

reviews.name: Quinn Parisi
reviews.title: Not worth the price
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2021
reviews.review:
For a “premium” diaper, these missed my expectations. There are much better options for the price.

Pros:
-quality materials
-slim design. It felt like much less diaper on my baby and less in the trash

Cons:
- these are absorbent but not enough for overnight. We actually had pee leak out the side, which has never happened with any other diaper brand. The diaper looked too full of liquid when i changed it
- even during daytime use, they feel slightly “wet” on the outside, which is weird
- my baby got a diaper rash when I didn’t use cream. They claim it’s unnecessary
- these diapers have a bad, almost chemically smelly
- the prints are so ugly! It says “see you at 2am on the butt”

reviews.name: Dana Green
reviews.title: Huge Downgrade
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020
reviews.review:
I saw so many people say that the quality had gone down on these diapers but I had no idea how much of a downgrade they would be. We had been buying the limitless flight up until this pack and these ones are disappointing. They are thin, rough and look cheap. The design isn’t cute and they don’t seem as absorbent. Please consider going back to the old version!

**Edited** I reordered these from Parasol directly and received the dog and leaf print pack. These were softer and a little better than the ones I got off amazon. Maybe they redesigned slightly again or the quality is just varied from batch to batch.

reviews.name: Chelsea Hernandez
reviews.title: Not as good as the originals.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
reviews.review:
We used parasol exclusively for three years and LOVED them. We just recently needed to start buying diapers again and I was really disappointed when I got these. The design (which is not a huge deal) sucks. I loved the three different packs you could buy in prints.
I was also really disappointed because they stretched so amazing around the waist when we had them before and this time they are very flimsy, I broke the first two I pulled on (no, I was not using my hulk strength). They work fine, I’m just sad that the quality has gone down so much in the past year or so.

reviews.name: giullia
reviews.title: honest review..
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.review: It’s a no for me with these diapers. Leak and no stretch. Waste of money

reviews.name: Bentley McClellan
reviews.title: Sizing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.review: Definitely not properly sized. Had to return because they were WAY too small ☹️

reviews.name: g373
reviews.title: Don't buy these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020
reviews.review: One of my least liked diapers. I tried the free samples from parasols website and they were soft and lovely. Unfortunately the diapers I ordered from amazon weren't very soft and didn't hold much of anything. I also strongly disliked the wings hanging off the side, they are ugly and serve no purpose.

reviews.name: Frederic Descamps
reviews.title: Unreliable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022
reviews.review:
Great sometimes but unreliable as we often get defectives diapers, sometimes a dozen in a row!
The quality control is poor.
We are switching back to Pampers after 6 months using Parasol.

reviews.name: Benjamin Francis
reviews.title: Nope, not worth the money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021
reviews.review: Poor leakage control, stiff, uncomfortable, and irritating. Will not buy again.

reviews.name: C. Teleki
reviews.title: Why So Expensive? Not Very Absorbent!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.review:
UPDATE - I just used the last diaper from this pack and I am SO glad I am done with them! I’m dropping to 2 stars from 3. When these get saturated, they don’t just stop absorbing like other diapers, and leak out the leg. The whole diaper just starts bleeding through into the clothes! The whole front of the onesie gets damp. I don’t usually let it get that wet but I tried one overnight and it was the pits in the morning. Also if my son drinks a bottle of milk I have to make sure I’ve changed him very recently or the big pee he has will be too much for this diaper to handle. Not good. Not good AT ALL.

These diapers are just as absorbent as Huggies, Pampers, and Mama Bear. Their fit is a little less trim than the other brands, but I haven’t had any leaks so that is apparently just aesthetic. The pocket print is pretty funny, as is the cheeky See you at 2:00 am message that’s on some of them. My one complaint is that the tabs (or the places that the tabs are connected to) could be longer. My little guy is pretty slender and they don’t reach very far onto his middle. Also there’s no built in stretch to the tabs like some of the other brands have.
Overall I would buy these diapers if I wasn’t such a price conscious consumer. They are more than twice the price of the Mama Bear diapers I otherwise use!

reviews.name: Anon
reviews.title: Recently changed design/quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
reviews.review: We loved these diapers for our little one...when the design was the leaves and birds (this older design would have been given a 5 star rating). The diapers are still soft and great for sensitive skin. However, we noticed that with the new clear and dry design of pants and "see you at 2AM," the quality is not the same. They do not absorb as much liquid and when we change our little one, we noticed that he is now covered in the absorbent crystals or material. These tend to stick to his skin and makes it much harder to clean him and change his diaper. Had to switch back to a different diaper. If the diaper ever goes back to it's old design, we'd switch back in a heart beat.

reviews.name: NJD & DMD
reviews.title: Cute but not the best choice in diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
reviews.review:
These PARASOL diapers are different than they used to be. Thinner, sheer sides, less elastic on the sides to hold the diaper close to the legs, and definitely not as absorbent. They're not as soft. Leakage is also a problem. The "velcro" connectors don't compare to the other name brands.

Because of them leaking, you use twice as many and have to deal with the inconvenience of wetness everywhere. They're cute, sure... but does that really matter. I'm sorry but I can't recommend this product.

This is one of the saddest reviews I’ve ever written.
PARASOL redesigned their diapers and pretty much destroyed the beloved brand.
The old diapers were thick and fluffy, very soft to touch, very absorbent (sleep through the night in one diaper), had strong connectors, sat taller preventing leaks. It was the only brand we were willing to use after trying multitude of diapers.
New redesigned diapers are thinner, insert feels like tissue paper, the aren’t as absorbent (at least one change at night after leak plus another change when baby wakes up soaked the pjs again), they don’t hold liquids inside as well (spill on the sides), the connectors rip easily while you stretch them to close the diaper.

VERY disappointing ‘upgrade’ !

Very cute, but the worst fit of any diaper I’ve ever tried! (And I’ve tried 7 of the most known brands)
I tried size 1 for newborns. My LO is average size and the diaper was simply huge for him at 1 month old. I tried again at month 2 and the fit is awful, awkwardly tight around the leg, yet extremely bulky, and so wide at the waist that it’s impossible to properly close. Had to throw them away because the number of leaks due to poor design were simply unacceptable.

reviews.name: Brandy Lyn
reviews.title: Not a fan
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
reviews.review: When we first received these diapers I thought they were cute with the little designs on the back. Turns out, that was all I was going to like about them. They have an awful fit on my two year old who fits into size 4s or 5s with popular branded diapers without a problem. These definitely are not leak proof either. They don't last the entire night without her waking up super damp at the very least. There's also like a lot of extra material on the diapers at the leg openings. It doesn't do anything, it's just there and makes the diaper look even bigger. Wouldn't order these again. Price point is way off for what I felt like I was getting.

reviews.name: Lin W.
reviews.title: Where to get the old one?
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2019
reviews.product_specs: Size: Size 4 (48 Count)Color: Born to Run
reviews.review: I miss the old version. Where to get the old one?

reviews.name: Mido
reviews.title: These are crap unless you wear pants
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2020
reviews.review: I don't know how a company could make crummy diapers in this day and age: The technology and design is clearly figured out. These are woefully lacking in velcro. They will stay on if you immediately pull on tight pants or pajamas, but we all know that kids don't wear pants all the time, and with these, they won't be wearing a diaper either.

reviews.name: Esmeralda344
reviews.title: The current design leaks quickly but is soft and the print is cute
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
reviews.review:
The PARASOL Clear+Dry Disposable Diapers are very soft and have a very cute design. I love the jean pocket print on the diaper. I loved the "See you at 2 am" slogan at first until I found out that it meant that I would see my baby at 2 am to change sheets, bedding, and clothes. This happened twice in one night and under three hours. I do not use these during the night any longer.
I have tried a lot of different diaper brands and out of most types, this diaper leaks the fastest. It cannot hold urine for longer than two and a half hours with my five month old. It leaks on his clothes and any longer than three it is just plain wet. The cover of the diaper also gets damp and makes his clothes damp. They work for a short time but I would not order again or recommend with the current design.
Pros:
*Ultra-soft
*Nice fit
*Cute design
*Does does not have an unusual odor
Cons:
*Leaks within a three hour period
*Does not appear to be moisture wicking

reviews.name: LegoDude
reviews.title: Definitely don't last the night
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
reviews.review:
These brag about no leaks, and lasting a night. Wrong in both counts.

I see a lot of people complaining about the design change from old to new, I can't attest to that, but I can say these are not something I would willingly use.

They just don't feel that good to the touch, they're thin and just feel "wimpy." We've had leaks and have to change part way through the night and still end up with soaked things in the morning.

reviews.name: Thraddash
reviews.title: Not for overnight use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
reviews.review: I wanted to love these diapers because it was made out of plant-based materials but sadly, they just fell short of the other major brands. They are soft enough and look cute but the overall design doesn't fit my very chubby baby perfectly and leaks do occur if she lies in an awkward way. I also would not recommend these for overnight use because they seldom last me longer than 3 1/2 hours before needing to be changed. I started changing them every two hours to avoid a soaked onesie and a major clean up. They seem fine for just regular sitting, for example in a high chair or bouncer, but if your baby is a mover like mine, I wouldn't recommend them.

reviews.name: Dana L.
reviews.title: Leaking issues
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
reviews.review: These diapers are soft and seem to support sensitive skin; however, the fit and functionality are horrible. Wouldn't recommend (tried size 1)

reviews.name: MyPenName
reviews.title: Wouldnt use again
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020
reviews.review: These didnt work out well with either toddler. They're soft on the inside but that's about the only good thing I can say. Not a good fit on either child, they leak, and the tabs pop off when trying to secure them.

reviews.name: John T. Horner
reviews.title: Not nearly as good as they used to be
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
reviews.review:
Something changed with the design of these formerly high end disposable diapers ("nappies" in Brit speak) and they don't fit or provide leak protection nearly as well as they used to.

One suspects that the cost-cutters got their hands on these and thought the customers wouldn't notice. That happens, yeah?

reviews.name: Thraddash
reviews.title: Not for overnight use
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020
reviews.review: I wanted to love these diapers because it was made out of plant-based materials but sadly, they just fell short of the other major brands. They are soft enough and look cute but the overall design doesn't fit my very chubby baby perfectly and leaks do occur if she lies in an awkward way. I also would not recommend these for overnight use because they seldom last me longer than 3 1/2 hours before needing to be changed. I started changing them every two hours to avoid a soaked onesie and a major clean up. They seem fine for just regular sitting, for example in a high chair or bouncer, but if your baby is a mover like mine, I wouldn't recommend them.

reviews.name: JS
reviews.title: The tags aren’t sticking
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
reviews.review:
I love this brand and was excited to use for my two kids. However, with this last package I purchased there have been so many unusable diapers because one of the tags won’t stick! I have had to throw out far too many duds! I contacted their customer service and was told I need to contact Amazon. Wouldn’t the company care about product performance?? This isn’t an Amazon issue, this is a manufacturer issue!

I originally posted this review and gave it two stars but since my post 3 days ago I have had 6 more tags not working on the diapers. They will be losing a customer that has multiple kids in diapers.

reviews.name: Eve C
reviews.title: Absolutely awful, poor absorption
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2024
reviews.review: I purchased these for their supposedly green and non-toxic materials. Unfortunately these are awful compared to pampers, luvs and Huggies. They do not absorb nor wick moisture away. My son is soaking wet and leaking into his clothes within 2-3 hours. Plus the material is odd in that it’s soft on the outside but bumpy on the inside, which is the part touching baby’s skin. These cost more than 2x pampers and 3x luvs, but are such poor quality.

reviews.name: Izzy Logsdon
reviews.title: Not the same quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2024
reviews.review: I got these diapers from Amazon a few times, and this order the diapers didn’t have any padding just paper and felt like cheap paper towel material. I’m not sure if this diapers some how missed a step in manufacturing or what. I can’t return them after 30 days and paid a lot of money for them.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Missing items
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are great, BUT I only received 1 pack of 64 count. Was missing 3 more packs.

reviews.name: Krisie
reviews.title: New material
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.product_specs: Size: Size 5 (48 Count)Color: Born to Run
reviews.review: I used to love this diaper but they recently changed the material. It's now very loose and breaks easily. It's almost pointless to have a diaper if it's going to be so flimsy and move frequently. I would no longer recommend this product. It's a shame because i was looking forward to sticking to them until potty training.

reviews.name: M
reviews.title: Newly redesigned diapers are awful
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2019
reviews.review:
This is one of the saddest reviews I’ve ever written.
PARASOL redesigned their diapers and pretty much destroyed the beloved brand.
The old diapers were thick and fluffy, very soft to touch, very absorbent (sleep through the night in one diaper), had strong connectors, sat taller preventing leaks. It was the only brand we were willing to use after trying multitude of diapers.
New redesigned diapers are thinner, insert feels like tissue paper, the aren’t as absorbent (at least one change at night after leak plus another change when baby wakes up soaked the pjs again), they don’t hold liquids inside as well (spill on the sides), the connectors rip easily while you stretch them to close the diaper.

VERY disappointing ‘upgrade’ !

reviews.name: Gabrielle
reviews.title: Horrible rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2024
reviews.review: I got a sample of these in the Amazon baby registry gift bag. Decided to use the first one on my 2 month old, after 1.5 hours she was screaming. Her whole diaper area was bright red. She was inconsolable until I gave her a milk bath and applied heavy diaper cream. She has used many different diaper brands since birth and never had a reaction or even diaper rash before. It was horrible seeing her in pain like that. Do not recommend :(

reviews.name: Memly
reviews.title: OMG Worst Diapers I Have Ever Used
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020
reviews.review:
I have three kids 6 and under so I go through and have gone through lots and lots of diapers. I have also tested many different brands, and different products from each brand from the big names, to generics, to smaller and designer as well as green brands. Even though I have my personal favorites, I would say that generally, all diapers I have used were pretty good (3-5 stars) and any complaints I had were very minor nits and nats. That said, this is the only time I have EVER had to give a 1 star review for any diaper I have used. How sad!!!

The only good thing I can say about this diaper is the cute packaging. It came in a brown cardboard box with animals printed on it. And it encouraged children to color and reuse the box. My children had fun coloring in the animals before the box went into the recycle bin.

Here are the biggest problems that I struggled with using these diapers. Never have I struggled this much...sigh...

1. The material soaks through. My baby always feels damp through this diaper. Every single morning, her entire outfit needs to be changed from urine soaking through. It doesn't matter if the diaper is only a little wet or completely full

2. It also leaks. It is just not absorbent enough and cannot be used overnight. Also it leaks due to flawed design because it also leaks from the leg openings. Urine...but unfortunately for us, I activated this pack of diapers when my little one had a bout of bronchitis and was on antibiotics which gave her diarrhea. No matter how bad or how much her No. 2 was... it leaked every single time. Not only was I dealing with a sick and cranky child, I was struggling with this diaper. I thought it was user error at first, but no matter how I fitted the diaper on her, how loose or tight I fastened it, I was always greeted with a huge mess. I opened a box of Huggies and everything was immediately better. And so was her sleep because she wasn't wet and cold at night. The manufacturer claims that leaks and blowouts are caused by sizing issues. I don't think so...but if this is true, perhaps I needed to go up a size or two. But then if that was necessary, then I would say these diapers run 1-2 sizes small because my baby is a true size 3 right now and these size 3's just did not work for us.

3. Doesn't wick moisture as well as it claims or as well as other diapers do. Baby bottom is always more damp, cold, clammy when using these diapers than others regardless of how wet/full the diaper is. I went through a lot more diaper cream using this diapers...

4. The tabs are small, flimsy, and short and do not fasten well. In the same size with any other brand the two velcro tabs always comes together at the front and can tough or overlap. On these diapers, the tabs cannot touch. They are actually 2-3 inches apart when fitted on my child (18 months old, 20 percentile in weight, and wears size 3), signalling that there is a lot less materials used in this diaper. The velcro tabs are also very small. You brush your arm against it and it comes loose. If you have a baby who loves to take of his or her own diaper they will be able to do it faster than ever before

5. Waistband area as mentioned above runs smaller than all other brands

6. I care about this the least...but the diapers are not that cute. They are white. One has "See you at 2 A.M." printed on it. Meant to be cute but is actually a slap in the face considering your child will be miserable by 2 AM and you will be up every single night if you use these. The other has a denim jean print. I thought it was cute when I first saw it but it actually don't look very cute once on the baby

I still have some left so I will finish out the pack now that my baby is feeling better and doesn't have diarrhea anymore. I only use during the day time and change very frequently. I would not purchase or recomend to others because just about any other diaper is better and will outperform this one

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Caused breakout

reviews.review: These diapers are super soft and seem absorbent enough. I got two in a sample pack and took a week or two from trying to first one to using the second one. I vowed I wouldn’t use the second one, because baby got a nasty red reaction to it. The person that changed her diaper didn’t realize it and it happened again. I would NOT recommend these diapers.

reviews.name: NewAdventures1981
reviews.title: Waist is small, legs opening HUGE
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2020
reviews.review: We were so excited to try these Clear&Dry diapers since they are free of all the nasty junk found in most diapers. However, they didn’t fit. My nephew is 5 months and 18 pounds. He is a chubby bundle of goodness! We got the size 3 since he is at the start of that weight range (size 3 starts at 16 pounds). The waist ran small and fit like a size 2 would but the leg openings were MASSIVE. Lots of space around the legs and zero growing room around the belly. We couldn’t leave him in this diaper since it had gaps on legs which of course would mean lots of leaks! We will try again in a few weeks but with the waist barely fitting now we aren’t too confident they will fit later on. They are very soft and the side tabs are quiet and stretchy... but that’s only helpful if the diaper actually fits. Pretty disappointed.

reviews.name: Katelyn S.
reviews.title: Causes diaper rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2019
reviews.review:
These diapers absorb very little. After my toddler has peed, they are noticeably damp to the touch on both the inside and outside of the diaper. Furthermore, during changes my toddler's skin is wet to the touch.

My toddlers are not prone to diaper rash, but the one who is not potty trained developed a gnarly rash right after we started using these. It's pretty shocking how little pee they hold and how poorly they keep my kid's skin dry.

For diapers that cost a whopping $0.67 each, as priced at the time of this review, they ought to be magic miracle diapers. Instead we're going to throw away the rest of the pack (these aren't even worth donating to a diaper bank) and go back to the $0.15 each store brand diapers that work better.

reviews.name: Jojo96
reviews.title: Leaking
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2023
reviews.review: Was excited to try these but they did not work. They leak And don’t hold up pee or poop. Very frustrating when changing baby in the middle of the night when every diaper change goes through.

reviews.name: Sadie Parker
reviews.title: 1 star
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020
reviews.review: I have always heard wonderful things about these diapers however I was not impressed at all. In my honest opinion, these diapers remind me of luvs, which is way cheaper than the cost of these diapers. They feel rough and are very thin and really aren't absorbent at all. Like I said, I would compare them to a cheap knock off brand that you get at a local super market not a brand suh as this with the high cost associated with it.

reviews.name: PositiveOutlook
reviews.title: Moldy smell odor
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2022
reviews.review: They smell moldy. They actually make me choke up a little bit. Definitely not putting these on baby :( maybe they're not moldy through another website/shipper? I can hardly catch my breath.

reviews.name: Alex A.
reviews.title: Extremely disappointing
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.review:
I ordered a sample pack of Parasol diapers a few months ago, before my daughter was even born. I had heard such good things! I love trying innovative products and supporting small businesses and I wanted to give my daughter the best. The sample pack Parasol sent me was Size 1, so we had to wait a few weeks until she was big enough to try them. When we did try the sample diapers, they were unimaginably soft, thick, and fit perfectly. I immediately ordered a huge box on Amazon.

The Parasol diapers I bought on Amazon are so terrible that I am wondering if there was an intentional bait and switch on the part of the company. This can’t be an issue of fake diapers because there are no third-party sellers of Parasol yet. I received genuine Parasol diapers. They just really really suck.

The pattern on these diapers is the same as the sample pack I got from Parasol, but they are thin, ill-fitting, and don’t hold much pee or poo. Because the diapers aren’t very absorbent, they are extra smelly. The wetness indicator doesn’t work reliably. We’ve only been using them for a couple of days, but we have had multiple leaks and a blowout.

These diapers look and feel like they were constructed by an intoxicated person using cheap tissues and off-brand tape. I’m not sure we’ll even use up the box I bought. We might just cut our losses.

I wouldn’t choose these diapers for my baby even if they were the cheapest on the market (but of course they are also super expensive). They are the worst.
